title: Yes, You Can Wear Brown Shoes with Black Pants, and Here’s How

steps.title: Choose medium shades of brown shoes.
steps.content: Choose medium shades of brown shoes. Medium shades of brown work the best because they have just the right amount of contrast with the black in your pants. Wearing a dark shade of brown may stand out more and clash instead of blending with your outfit. [1] X Research source While you can try lighter brown shades, like tan shoes, for a really bold look, they may contrast and stand out against black pants too much.

steps.title: Match your shoes with other accessories.
steps.content: Match your shoes with other accessories. Don’t let your shoes be the only time brown shows up in your outfit. Put on a brown belt or watch band, wear a brown tie or pocket square, or choose clothes that have brown buttons or accent pieces to make your shoes look like an intentional choice. [2] X Research source You could also wear a coat or jacket that’s the same shade of brown, or wear sunglasses with brown lenses for a casual style.

steps.title: Stick to black shoes and black pants for formal events.
steps.content: Stick to black shoes and black pants for formal events. Lighter colors like brown are typically considered a little more informal than black shoes. If you’re heading to a casual get-together with friends or an informal work meeting, then it’s OK to wear brown shoes with black pants. If you’re attending a black-tie event or a formal occasion like a wedding or funeral, then stick to wearing black shoes with black pants. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Go with neutral tones like white, navy, gray, or muted colors.
steps.content: Go with neutral tones like white, navy, gray, or muted colors. Because brown shoes and black pants already incorporate a few different shades, avoid adding other bold colors to your outfit. A classic white, grey, or navy shirt looks great, but don’t be afraid to try out other tones, like olive, burgundy, or mustard. Neutral shades can either have cool or warm undertones. If you’re also wearing accessories that include neutral tones, make sure they all have the same undertone as your shirt. [4] X Research source Most stylists recommend not using more than 3 different colors in an outfit, but others say it’s okay to include more. Play around with your personal style and see what looks best on you.

steps.title: Wear brown wingtips, Oxfords, or Derby shoes for a professional look.
steps.content: Wear brown wingtips , Oxfords , or Derby shoes for a professional look. If you want to look your best in brown shoes and black pants at the office or at an informal event, then a pair of dressier shoes is the way to go. These shoes work best with black dress pants or slacks to up your style game. Oxfords and Derby shoes are a little more casual than wingtips, but they still look classy in a more formal outfit. Wear no-show socks or socks of a neutral tone with brown shoes and black pants so they don’t stand out.

steps.title: Put on brown sneakers or loafers to rock a casual style.
steps.content: Put on brown sneakers or loafers to rock a casual style. If you want to keep your outfit a little more informal, like if you’re wearing black jeans, sneakers and loafers are comfortable and stylish. Choose sneakers or loafers when you’re wearing black jeans or other informal pants styles. [5] X Research source Choose sneakers that have solid colors without a lot of accents, or else they may make your outfit look a little busy.

steps.title: Try out brown boots if your pants cover your ankles.
steps.content: Try out brown boots if your pants cover your ankles. Boots can work well with black pants whether you’re just going out with friends or having a casual day at work. Just make sure the cuffs of your pants cover the ankles of your boots so they don’t stick out or look out of place.

steps.title: Black suit
steps.content: Black suit Even though you may normally wear black shoes with a suit, brown shoes work with the style just as well. Make sure to bring in brown with another accessory, like a belt, tie, or watch band so your shoes look like an intentional choice. [6] X Research source Avoid light brown or tan shoes with a black suit since they’ll stand out too much. Remember that lighter colors like brown make your outfit more casual. If you’re wearing a suit to a formal or black-tie event, stick to black dress shoes instead.

steps.title: Blazer, black shirt, and black chinos
steps.content: Blazer, black shirt, and black chinos If you’re looking for a classier look to wear out, put on a classic black T-shirt or button-up underneath a blazer. Pair the look with some black chinos and slightly darker boots or wingtips for a bold style. Tuck a pocket square into your blazer for some added contrast. White or any other pale color will look great with the rest of your outfit.

steps.title: White dress shirt and black dress pants
steps.content: White dress shirt and black dress pants A classic white dress shirt is a staple in most wardrobes, and it’s the perfect match with your black dress pants. Pair this look with brown wingtips or Oxfords if you’re heading to a dressier event, or try it out with boots or loafers for a more relaxed look. [7] X Research source Add a little more class with a brown tie or a white shirt that has brown buttons so your outfit looks more unified.

steps.title: Plaid long-sleeved shirt and black trousers
steps.content: Plaid long-sleeved shirt and black trousers Plaid or checkered shirts add a fun pattern to your outfit, and they can really play up the style of your brown shoes. Choose a buttoned shirt with neutral colors and pair it with your trousers. Tuck the plaid shirt in if you’re going for a more formal look, or leave it untucked to keep it casual. [8] X Research source Wear a solid-colored tie that compliments your shoes, such as navy or beige. To elevate your look even more, put on a sport jacket that matches your pants.

steps.title: Polo shirt and black slacks
steps.content: Polo shirt and black slacks A navy or muted polo shirt looks great for a casual look at work or an informal event where you don’t want to feel overdressed. Complete your look with black slacks paired with some brown boots or Derby shoes. Accessorize with a brown leather belt or a brown watch band to tie your entire look together. Polos also pair really well with black jeans.

steps.title: Sweater, dress shirt, and black jeans
steps.content: Sweater, dress shirt, and black jeans If you want to rock black pants with brown shoes when it gets colder, then put a solid-colored crewneck sweater over your dress shirt. Black jeans along with some brown sneakers or loafers make this the perfect stylish and comfortable outfit. [9] X Research source Skip the dress shirt and put on a turtleneck sweater instead for a really sophisticated look.

steps.title: Leather jacket and black jeans
steps.content: Leather jacket and black jeans Try out an edgier style when you go out with a black leather jacket along with a neutral T-shirt or button-up. Along with black jeans and brown sneakers or boots, you’re sure to draw some attention to your outfit. For a little added contrast, cuff your jeans just below your ankle. This looks really stylish when you do it with brown boots.

steps.title: Tan suede jacket and black corduroys
steps.content: Tan suede jacket and black corduroys Try to choose a jacket that’s close in color to your shoes so your entire outfit looks cohesive. Wear a T-shirt, sweater, or button-up that has muted colors underneath so your jacket and brown shoes stand out the most. Play around with different layers of clothing to experiment with your style. A burgundy sweater over a white button-up looks great when you top off your style with a suede jacket.

steps.title: Button-down shirt with black dress pants
steps.content: Button-down shirt with black dress pants Solid-colored button-ups look great, especially with neutral tones like white, beige, or grey, but you can try some simple patterns as well. Tuck your shirt in and wear some brown dress shoes to give your outfit the most professional look. Try to accessorize with brown bracelets or jewelry that compliment the color of your shoes and make your outfit look the most cohesive.

steps.title: Blazer, blouse, and black slacks
steps.content: Blazer, blouse, and black slacks If you want a business-ready style with a hint of class, just put a dark blazer over a light-colored blouse. Finish off your look with some black pants and brown loafers, and you have an outfit ready for the office or any semi-casual event with your friends. Carry a brown handbag to store your things and match your outfit.

steps.title: Ribbed knit sweater and black jeans
steps.content: Ribbed knit sweater and black jeans If you want to look stylish and feel cozy at the same time, put on your favorite solid-colored sweater with your black jeans. Either a crewneck or a turtleneck looks great paired with brown boots or heels. You could even tuck your jeans into brown boots that come up to your mid-calves or knees.

steps.title: Denim shirt with black corduroys
steps.content: Denim shirt with black corduroys Go with a classic blue denim shirt to create a timeless style with your black pants. Complete your look with a brown-patterned heel or any dress shoe and you’re ready to go. Put on a tan or blazer or sport coat that matches your shoes for an even more polished style.

steps.title: Tan overcoat and black slacks
steps.content: Tan overcoat and black slacks When the weather starts to get colder and you want to stay warm yet stylish, go with a light tan coat over your favorite top. Pair your slacks with some chunky brown heels or boots for a look that’s perfect for casual work days or any get-together. Tan overcoats look especially great if your black pants have a slight pattern or checker.

steps.title: Black jumpsuit
steps.content: Black jumpsuit Jumpsuits are perfect casual wear, but also look great during other informal events. Stick with a lighter brown or tan shoe that stands out from the rest of your outfit.

steps.title: Patterned blouse and black leggings
steps.content: Patterned blouse and black leggings If you want a casual look, choose any patterned blouse as long as it has neutral or muted colors. With a simple pair of black leggings, a pair of brown boots or heels will make your outfit look simple but stylish. If you have one, try to pick a blouse that has the same color as your shoes somewhere in the pattern to tie your outfit together.

steps.title: Mesh top and black leather pants
steps.content: Mesh top and black leather pants If you’re looking for a trendy outfit, stick with a black mesh top with a dark bra underneath. The sheen of black leather pants paired with a lighter brown heel is sure to draw some attention your way. For a more modest style, wear a black coat or brown coat over your mesh top.

steps.title: Can you mix neutrals?
steps.content: Can you mix neutrals? Absolutely! Feel free to mix colors like black, brown, grey, tan, white, and navy. For the most put-together look, keep it to 3 neutrals max per outfit and try to include at least 2 items in each color. For instance, you might go with a black top, brown belt, jeans, brown shoes, and a black watch, hat, or jacket. [10] X Research source

steps.title: What other pants colors work with brown shoes?
steps.content: What other pants colors work with brown shoes? Brown shoes are really versatile because they can match with nearly any color. If you don’t want to wear black pants with brown shoes, then try out navy, blue, grey, brown, or khaki pants. Brown shoes even look great with a casual pair of jeans. [11] X Research source

steps.title: What color shoes go with black pants?
steps.content: What color shoes go with black pants? Black pants are neutral, so they work well with any other shoe color as long it complements your shirt and accessories. For a formal occasion, stick to black shoes, but don’t be afraid to try white, grey, midnight blue, or any other color when you’re just keeping it casual.

steps.title: What pant colors go with black shoes?
steps.content: What pant colors go with black shoes? Black shoes work great when you’re wearing darker colors, such as black, charcoal grey, and midnight blue. They even look great with jeans. [12] X Research source
